original: Ysander, David Torsten, biskop, Linköping, f. 10/3/93 i Tölö, Hall. 1., av kyrkoh. Bengt Y. o. Amanda Wetter-quist. G. 23 m. Ebba Key-Aberg. Barn: Berit f. 24, Ursula 25, Bengt-Christer 31. — Stud:ex. v. Gbgs h. latin 11, teol. fil. ex. i Gbg 12, fil. kand. där 1’5, teol. kand. o. prakt. teol. ex. i Upps. samt prästex. i Gbg 19, teol. lic. i Upps. 25, teol. dr där 33. Fas,t :adj. i Upps. 19-20, tf. kyrkoh. i Vänge-Läby 20, ord. 23-30, tf. kontr :prost 22-24, pred. v. Akad. sjukih. i Upps. 20, adj. led. i Upps. dom-kap. somr. 26-23, sekr. i ärkestiftets stiftsråd 26, förest, f. sam^t lär. i kris-tend. v. Fjellstedtska sk. i Upps. 30-36, docent i teol. preno-t. o. teol. encykl. v. Upps. univ. 331-35, domprost i Gbg 315, biskop i Visby stift 36-47, e. o. hov-pred. 39, biskop i Linköp. stift fr. 47. Res. t. Engl. 12, Fölen o. Österr. 22, Engl. o. Holl. 27. Skr.: Det andl. nutidsläget o. kyrkan (19), Vänge-Läby förs :hem (28), Gudsordet o. religionerna (30), Das Judentum nach Ghristus (31), Missionen - Guds hemlighet (32), Hasidismien (33), Förkunnelsen o. för-kunnaren (tills. m. B. Jonzon 34), Herdabrev (3*7), I Gbgs domkyrka (37), Från Visby S :ta Maria (41), De hundra kyrkornas ö (41), Lyckans villkor (44), Folkförsoningen o. vedergällningen (44) m. fl. skr. i relig:hist. o. teol. frågor, art. i teol. o. kyrkl. tidskr. samt dagspressen. KNOlkl,
translated: Ysander, David Torsten, bishop, Linköping, b. 10/3/93 in Tölö, Hall. 1st son of clergyman Bengt Y. and Amanda Wetterquist. Married on 23rd to Ebba Key-Aberg. Children: Berit b. 24, Ursula b. 25, Bengt-Christer b. 31. Studied: graduated from Gothenburg High Latin School in 1911, theology degree from Gothenburg in 1912, Bachelor of Arts there in 1915, theology degree and practical theology exam in Uppsala, and priest exam in Gothenburg in 1919, Licentiate of Theology in Uppsala in 1925, Doctor of Theology there in 1933. Positions held: assistant professor in Uppsala 1919-1920, acting vicar of Vänge-Läby from 1920, regular from 1923-1930, acting archdeacon from 1922-1924, preacher at the Academic Hospital in Uppsala in 1920, assistant member of the Uppsala Cathedral Chapter in the summers of 1926-1928, secretary in the diocesan council of the archbishopric in 1926, head and teacher in Christian doctrine at the Fjellstedtska School in Uppsala from 1930-1936, docent in practical theology and theological encyclopaedia at Uppsala University from 1931-1935, dean in Gothenburg since 1935, bishop of the Visby Diocese from 1936-1947, temporary court preacher in 1939, bishop of the Linköping Diocese since 1947. Travels: visited England in 1912, Austria in 1922, England and the Netherlands in 1927. Writings: The Present Spiritual Situation and the Church (1919), Vänge-Läby Parish Home (1928), The Word of God and the Religions (1930), Judaism after Christ (1931), Mission - God's Secret (1932), Hasidism (1933), Preaching and the Preacher (co-authored with B. Jonzon, 1934), Pastoral Letter (1937), In Gothenburg Cathedral (1937), From Visby St. Mary (1941), The Hundred Churches' Island (1941), The Conditions of Happiness (1944), National Reconciliation and Retribution (1944), among other writings on religious history and theological topics, as well as articles in theological and church journals, and daily press. Knight of the Royal Order of the Polar Star (KNOlkl).
